intro: Henriettella sessilifolia, commonly known as the sessile-leaf henriettella, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its simple, sessile leaves that are often clustered at the base of the stems. Its flowers are small and typically white or pale pink, arranged in clusters. Henriettella sessilifolia is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its unique foliage and delicate floral display.
